cantrips.name: Acid Splash
cantrips.description: You hurl a bubble of acid. Choose one or two creatures within range and within 5 feet of each other. A target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d6 acid damage.

cantrips.name: Blade Ward
cantrips.description: You have resistance against bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage dealt by weapon attacks until the end of your next turn.

cantrips.name: Chill Touch
cantrips.description: A ghostly skeletal hand strikes at a creature. Make a ranged spell attack. On hit, 1d8 necrotic damage and the target can't regain HP until your next turn. Against undead, the target also has disadvantage on attack rolls against you.

cantrips.name: Druidcraft
cantrips.description: Create a tiny, harmless sensory effect that predicts the weather, make a flower bloom or a seed pod open, create a harmless sensory effect, or instantly light or snuff out a small flame.

cantrips.name: Eldritch Blast
cantrips.description: A beam of crackling energy streaks toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On hit, the target takes 1d10 force damage.

cantrips.name: Fire Bolt
cantrips.description: You hurl a mote of fire at a creature or object. Make a ranged spell attack. On hit, 1d10 fire damage. A flammable object hit ignites if it isn't being worn or carried.

cantrips.name: Guidance
cantrips.description: The target can roll a d4 and add the number to one ability check of its choice. It can roll the die before or after making the check.

cantrips.name: Light
cantrips.components: V, M (a firefly or phosphorescent moss)
cantrips.description: An object you touch sheds bright light in a 20-foot radius and dim light for an additional 20 feet. A creature holding the object can dismiss the effect as an action. Hostile creature: Dexterity save to avoid.

cantrips.name: Mage Hand
cantrips.description: A spectral, floating hand appears. The hand can manipulate objects, open unlocked doors, stow or retrieve items, or pour out vials. It can't attack, activate magic items, or carry more than 10 pounds.

cantrips.name: Mending
cantrips.description: This spell repairs a single break or tear in an object you touch (no larger than 1 foot in any dimension). Can physically repair a magic item but can't restore magic to such an object.

cantrips.name: Minor Illusion
cantrips.description: Create a sound or an image of an object (no larger than a 5-foot cube). The illusion can't create sound, light, smell, or sensory effects. An Investigation check against your spell save DC reveals it as an illusion.

cantrips.name: Poison Spray
cantrips.description: You project a puff of noxious gas at a creature within range. The creature must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or take 1d12 poison damage.

cantrips.name: Prestidigitation
cantrips.description: A minor magical trick: create a harmless sensory effect, light/snuff a small flame, clean/soil a small object, chill/warm/flavor nonliving material, create a small mark or symbol on a surface for 1 hour, or create a trinket/illusion that fits in your hand for one round.

cantrips.name: Produce Flame
cantrips.description: A flickering flame appears in your hand (bright light 10 ft, dim light 10 ft more). You can also hurl the flame at a creature within 30 ft: ranged spell attack for 1d8 fire damage.

cantrips.name: Ray of Frost
cantrips.description: A frigid beam of blue-white light streaks toward a creature. Make a ranged spell attack. On hit, 1d8 cold damage and the target's speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.

cantrips.name: Resistance
cantrips.description: The target can roll a d4 and add it to one saving throw of its choice before the spell ends.

cantrips.name: Sacred Flame
cantrips.description: Flame-like radiance descends on a creature you can see. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 1d8 radiant damage. The target gains no benefit from cover for this saving throw.

cantrips.name: Shillelagh
cantrips.components: V, S, M (mistletoe, shamrock leaf, and a club or quarterstaff)
cantrips.description: A club or quarterstaff you are holding is imbued with nature's power. For the duration, you can use your spellcasting ability instead of Strength for attack and damage rolls, and the weapon's damage die becomes a d8.

cantrips.name: Spare the Dying
cantrips.description: A living creature that has 0 hit points becomes stable. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

cantrips.name: Thaumaturgy
cantrips.description: You manifest a minor wonder: your voice booms up to 3x louder, cause flames to flicker/brighten/dim/change color, cause tremors, create an instant sound, cause a door or window to slam open or shut, or alter the appearance of your eyes.

cantrips.name: Vicious Mockery
cantrips.description: You unleash a string of insults laced with subtle enchantments. If the target can hear you, it must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take 1d4 psychic damage and have disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

level_1.name: Bless
level_1.components: V, S, M (a sprinkling of holy water)
level_1.description: You bless up to three creatures of your choice within range. Whenever a target makes an attack roll or a saving throw before the spell ends, the target can roll a d4 and add the number rolled.

level_1.name: Burning Hands
level_1.description: A thin sheet of flames shoots from your fingertips. Each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 3d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one.

level_1.name: Charm Person
level_1.description: You attempt to charm a humanoid you can see. It must make a Wisdom saving throw (advantage if you or your companions are fighting it). If it fails, it is charmed by you until the spell ends or you harm it.

level_1.name: Cure Wounds
level_1.description: A creature you touch regains a number of hit points equal to 1d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

level_1.name: Detect Magic
level_1.description: For the duration, you sense the presence of magic within 30 feet of you. You can use your action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object that bears magic, and you learn its school of magic.

level_1.name: Disguise Self
level_1.description: You make yourself — including your clothing, armor, weapons, and other belongings — look different. You can seem 1 foot shorter or taller and can appear thin, fat, or in between. Investigation check against your spell save DC to discern the disguise.

level_1.name: Faerie Fire
level_1.description: Each object in a 20-foot cube within range is outlined in blue, green, or violet light. Any creature in the area when the spell is cast must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or also be outlined. Attack rolls against an affected creature or object have advantage. Invisible creatures become visible.

level_1.name: Healing Word
level_1.description: A creature of your choice that you can see within range regains hit points equal to 1d4 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs.

level_1.name: Hex
level_1.components: V, S, M (the petrified eye of a newt)
level_1.description: You place a curse on a creature that you can see within range. Until the spell ends, you deal an extra 1d6 necrotic damage to the target whenever you hit it with an attack. Also, choose one ability; the target has disadvantage on ability checks made with the chosen ability.

level_1.name: Hunter's Mark
level_1.description: You choose a creature you can see within range and mystically mark it as your quarry. Until the spell ends, you deal an extra 1d6 damage to the target whenever you hit it with a weapon attack. You also have advantage on any Wisdom (Perception) or Wisdom (Survival) check you make to find it.

level_1.name: Mage Armor
level_1.components: V, S, M (a piece of cured leather)
level_1.description: You touch a willing creature who isn't wearing armor, and a protective magical force surrounds it until the spell ends. The target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

level_1.name: Magic Missile
level_1.description: You create three glowing darts of magical force. Each dart hits a creature of your choice that you can see within range. A dart deals 1d4 + 1 force damage. The darts all strike simultaneously. At higher levels: one additional dart per slot level above 1st.

level_1.name: Shield
level_1.casting_time: 1 reaction (when hit by an attack or targeted by magic missile)
level_1.description: An invisible barrier of magical force appears and protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC, including against the triggering attack, and you take no damage from magic missile.

level_1.name: Shield of Faith
level_1.components: V, S, M (a small parchment with a bit of holy text written on it)
level_1.description: A shimmering field appears and surrounds a creature of your choice within range, granting it a +2 bonus to AC for the duration.

level_1.name: Sleep
level_1.components: V, S, M (a pinch of fine sand, rose petals, or a cricket)
level_1.description: This spell sends creatures into a magical slumber. Roll 5d8; the total is how many hit points of creatures this spell can affect. Starting with the creature that has the lowest current hit points, each creature falls unconscious until the spell ends, the sleeper takes damage, or someone uses an action to shake or slap it awake.

level_1.name: Speak with Animals
level_1.description: You gain the ability to comprehend and verbally communicate with beasts for the duration. The knowledge and awareness of many beasts is limited by their intelligence, but at minimum, beasts can give you information about nearby locations and monsters.

level_1.name: Thunderwave
level_1.description: A wave of thunderous force sweeps out from you. Each creature in a 15-foot cube must make a Constitution saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 2d8 thunder damage and is pushed 10 feet away from you. On a successful save, the creature takes half damage and isn't pushed.

level_2.name: Aid
level_2.components: V, S, M (a tiny strip of white cloth)
level_2.description: Your spell bolsters your allies with toughness and resolve. Choose up to three creatures within range. Each target's hit point maximum and current hit points increase by 5 for the duration. At higher levels: increase by an additional 5 for each slot level above 2nd.

level_2.name: Alter Self
level_2.components: V, S
level_2.description: You assume a different form. Choose one option: Aquatic Adaptation (breathe underwater, swim speed equal to walking speed), Change Appearance (alter your appearance including height, weight, facial features, voice, hair, coloration, and distinguishing characteristics), or Natural Weapons (grow claws, fangs, horns, etc. — 1d6+STR bludgeoning/piercing/slashing, you are proficient, and they are magical).

level_2.name: Animal Messenger
level_2.components: V, S, M (a morsel of food)
level_2.description: You use an animal to deliver a message. Choose a Tiny beast you can see within range and specify a location and a recipient. The beast travels to that location for the duration, covering 50 miles per 24 hours (flying) or 25 miles (other). When the messenger arrives, it delivers your message (up to 25 words) in your voice.

level_2.name: Arcane Lock
level_2.components: V, S, M (gold dust worth at least 25 gp, which the spell consumes)
level_2.description: You touch a closed door, window, gate, chest, or other entryway, and it becomes locked for the duration. You and creatures you designate can open the object normally. You can also set a password that suppresses the spell for 1 minute. The DC to break or pick the lock increases by 10.

level_2.name: Augury
level_2.components: V, S, M (specially marked sticks, bones, or similar tokens worth at least 25 gp)
level_2.description: You receive an omen from an otherworldly entity about the results of a specific course of action that you plan to take within the next 30 minutes. The DM chooses from: Weal (good results), Woe (bad results), Weal and Woe (both), or Nothing (neither). Successive castings before a long rest have a cumulative 25% chance of giving a random reading.

level_2.name: Barkskin
level_2.components: V, S, M (a handful of oak bark)
level_2.description: You touch a willing creature. Until the spell ends, the target's skin has a rough, bark-like appearance, and the target's AC can't be less than 16, regardless of what kind of armor it is wearing.

level_2.name: Blindness/Deafness
level_2.components: V
level_2.description: You can blind or deafen a foe. Choose one creature within range to make a Constitution saving throw. If it fails, the target is either blinded or deafened (your choice) for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make a Constitution saving throw to end the effect. At higher levels: target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

level_2.name: Blur
level_2.components: V
level_2.description: Your body becomes blurred, shifting and wavering to all who can see you. For the duration, any creature has disadvantage on attack rolls against you. An attacker is immune to this effect if it doesn't rely on sight or can see through illusions.

level_2.name: Branding Smite
level_2.components: V
level_2.description: The next time you hit a creature with a weapon attack before this spell ends, the weapon gleams with astral radiance. The attack deals an extra 2d6 radiant damage. The target becomes visible if it's invisible, and it sheds dim light in a 5-foot radius and can't become invisible until the spell ends.

level_2.name: Calm Emotions
level_2.components: V, S
level_2.description: You attempt to suppress strong emotions in a group of people. Each humanoid in a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose must make a Charisma saving throw. You can choose to suppress the effects of being charmed or frightened, or make a target indifferent about creatures of your choice that it is hostile toward.

level_2.name: Cloud of Daggers
level_2.components: V, S, M (a sliver of glass)
level_2.description: You fill the air with spinning daggers in a cube 5 feet on each side, centered on a point you choose within range. A creature takes 4d4 slashing damage when it enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there. At higher levels: damage increases by 2d4 for each slot level above 2nd.

level_2.name: Continual Flame
level_2.components: V, S, M (ruby dust worth 50 gp, which the spell consumes)
level_2.description: A flame, equivalent in brightness to a torch, springs forth from an object that you touch. The effect looks like a regular flame, but it creates no heat and doesn't use oxygen. A continual flame can be covered or hidden but not smothered or quenched.

level_2.name: Crown of Madness
level_2.components: V, S
level_2.description: One humanoid of your choice must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become charmed for the duration. A twisted crown of jagged iron appears on its head. The charmed target must use its action before moving on each of its turns to make a melee attack against a creature other than itself that you mentally choose.

level_2.name: Darkness
level_2.components: V, M (bat fur and a drop of pitch or piece of coal)
level_2.description: Magical darkness spreads from a point you choose within range to fill a 15-foot-radius sphere. Darkvision can't see through it, and nonmagical light can't illuminate it. If cast on an object, the darkness moves with it. Completely covering the object blocks the darkness. It dispels any light spell of 2nd level or lower.

level_2.name: Darkvision
level_2.components: V, S, M (either a pinch of dried carrot or an agate)
level_2.description: You touch a willing creature to grant it the ability to see in the dark. For the duration, that creature has darkvision out to a range of 60 feet.

level_2.name: Detect Thoughts
level_2.components: V, S, M (a copper piece)
level_2.description: For the duration, you can read the thoughts of certain creatures. You initially learn the surface thoughts of any creature within 30 feet. As an action, you can focus on one creature to probe deeper — it must make a Wisdom saving throw. On failure, you gain insight into its reasoning, emotional state, and something that looms large in its mind.

level_2.name: Enhance Ability
level_2.components: V, S, M (fur or a feather from a beast)
level_2.description: You touch a creature and bestow upon it a magical enhancement. Choose one effect: Bear's Endurance (advantage on CON checks, 2d6 temp HP), Bull's Strength (advantage on STR checks, carrying capacity doubles), Cat's Grace (advantage on DEX checks, no fall damage from 20 feet or less), Eagle's Splendor (advantage on CHA checks), Fox's Cunning (advantage on INT checks), or Owl's Wisdom (advantage on WIS checks). At higher levels: target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

level_2.name: Enlarge/Reduce
level_2.components: V, S, M (a pinch of powdered iron)
level_2.description: You cause a creature or object to grow larger or smaller. Enlarge: target's size doubles, weight x8, size up one category, advantage on STR checks and saves, +1d4 weapon damage. Reduce: target's size halves, weight x1/8, size down one category, disadvantage on STR checks and saves, −1d4 weapon damage. Unwilling target makes a CON save.

level_2.name: Enthrall
level_2.components: V, S
level_2.description: You weave a distracting string of words, causing creatures of your choice that can hear you to make a Wisdom saving throw. Any creature that can't be charmed succeeds automatically. On a failed save, the target has disadvantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks to notice any creature other than you.

level_2.name: Find Steed
level_2.components: V, S
level_2.description: You summon a spirit that assumes the form of an unusually intelligent, strong, and loyal steed (warhorse, pony, camel, elk, or mastiff). The steed serves you as a mount and has a telepathic bond with you within 1 mile. When the steed drops to 0 HP, it disappears. You can dismiss it as an action. While mounted, spells that target only you also target the steed.

level_2.name: Find Traps
level_2.components: V, S
level_2.description: You sense the presence of any trap within range that is within line of sight. A trap includes anything that would inflict a sudden or unexpected effect you consider harmful or undesirable. You learn the general nature of the danger but not the exact location of each trap.

level_2.name: Flame Blade
level_2.components: V, S, M (leaf of sumac)
level_2.description: You evoke a fiery blade in your free hand. The blade is similar in size and shape to a scimitar, and it lasts for the duration. You can use your action to make a melee spell attack with the fiery blade. On a hit, the target takes 3d6 fire damage. The blade sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for 10 more feet. At higher levels: damage increases by 1d6 for every two slot levels above 2nd.

level_2.name: Flaming Sphere
level_2.components: V, S, M (a bit of tallow, a pinch of brimstone, and a dusting of powdered iron)
level_2.description: A 5-foot-diameter sphere of fire appears in an unoccupied space. Any creature that ends its turn within 5 feet must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 2d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half on success. As a bonus action, you can move the sphere up to 30 feet. At higher levels: damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 2nd.

level_2.name: Gentle Repose
level_2.components: V, S, M (a pinch of salt and one copper piece placed on each of the corpse's eyes)
level_2.description: You touch a corpse or other remains. For the duration, the target is protected from decay and can't become undead. The spell also effectively extends the time limit on raising the target from the dead, since days spent under the influence of this spell don't count against the time limit of spells such as raise dead.

level_2.name: Gust of Wind
level_2.components: V, S, M (a legume seed)
level_2.description: A line of strong wind 60 feet long and 10 feet wide blasts from you in a direction you choose. Each creature that starts its turn in the line must succeed on a Strength saving throw or be pushed 15 feet away from you in the direction of the line. Any creature in the line must spend 2 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves when moving closer to you. The gust disperses gas or vapor.

level_2.name: Heat Metal
level_2.components: V, S, M (a piece of iron and a flame)
level_2.description: Choose a manufactured metal object (such as a weapon or suit of armor) within range. You cause the object to glow red-hot. Any creature in contact with it takes 2d8 fire damage. Until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action to cause damage again. If a creature is holding or wearing the object and takes damage, it must make a CON save or drop it. If it can't drop it, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks.

level_2.name: Hold Person
level_2.components: V, S, M (a small, straight piece of iron)
level_2.description: Choose a humanoid that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be paralyzed for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another Wisdom saving throw, ending the effect on a success. At higher levels: target one additional humanoid for each slot level above 2nd.

level_2.name: Invisibility
level_2.components: V, S, M (an eyelash encased in gum arabic)
level_2.description: A creature you touch becomes invisible until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is invisible as long as it is on the target's person. The spell ends for a target that attacks or casts a spell. At higher levels: target one additional creature for each slot level above 2nd.

level_2.name: Knock
level_2.components: V
level_2.description: Choose an object that you can see within range. The object can be a door, a box, a chest, a set of manacles, a padlock, or another object that contains a mundane or magical means that prevents access. A target held shut by a mundane lock or stuck/barred becomes unlocked/unstuck/unbarred. If the object has multiple locks, only one is unlocked. An object locked with arcane lock is suppressed for 10 minutes. When you cast the spell, a loud knock emanates audible from 300 feet.

level_2.name: Lesser Restoration
level_2.components: V, S
level_2.description: You touch a creature and can end either one disease or one condition afflicting it. The condition can be blinded, deafened, paralyzed, or poisoned.

level_2.name: Levitate
level_2.components: V, S, M (either a small leather loop or a piece of golden wire bent into a cup shape with a long shank on one end)
level_2.description: One creature or object of your choice rises vertically, up to 20 feet, and remains suspended there for the duration. You can change the altitude by up to 20 feet on each of your turns. An unwilling creature that succeeds on a Constitution saving throw is unaffected. The target can move only by pushing or pulling against a fixed object or surface.

level_2.name: Locate Animals or Plants
level_2.components: V, S, M (a bit of fur from a bloodhound)
level_2.description: Describe or name a specific kind of beast or plant. Concentrating on the voice of nature in your surroundings, you learn the direction and distance to the closest creature or plant of that kind within 5 miles, if any are present.

level_2.name: Locate Object
level_2.components: V, S, M (a forked twig)
level_2.description: Describe or name an object that is familiar to you. You sense the direction to the object's location, as long as that object is within 1,000 feet of you. If the object is in motion, you know the direction of its movement. The spell can't locate an object if any thickness of lead blocks a direct path between you and the object.

level_2.name: Magic Mouth
level_2.components: V, S, M (a small bit of honeycomb and jade dust worth at least 10 gp, which the spell consumes)
level_2.description: You implant a message within an object in range, a message that is uttered when a trigger condition is met. The message can be up to 25 words long and can be delivered over as long as 10 minutes. You determine the triggering circumstance. The mouth can't cast spells or activate magic items.

level_2.name: Magic Weapon
level_2.components: V, S
level_2.description: You touch a nonmagical weapon. Until the spell ends, that weapon becomes a magic weapon with a +1 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls. At higher levels: +2 bonus at 4th level, +3 bonus at 6th level.

level_2.name: Mirror Image
level_2.components: V, S
level_2.description: Three illusory duplicates of yourself appear in your space. Each time a creature targets you with an attack, roll a d20 to determine whether the attack instead targets one of your duplicates. With three duplicates, you must roll a 6 or higher. With two, 8 or higher. With one, 11 or higher. A duplicate's AC is 10 + your DEX modifier. An attack that hits a duplicate destroys it.

level_2.name: Misty Step
level_2.components: V
level_2.description: Briefly surrounded by silvery mist, you teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space that you can see.

level_2.name: Moonbeam
level_2.components: V, S, M (several seeds of any moonseed plant and a piece of opalescent feldspar)
level_2.description: A silvery beam of pale light shines down in a 5-foot-radius, 40-foot-high cylinder. When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it is engulfed in ghostly flames and must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 2d10 radiant damage on a failed save, or half on success. A shapechanger makes the save with disadvantage. On each of your turns, you can use an action to move the beam 60 feet.

level_2.name: Pass without Trace
level_2.components: V, S, M (ashes from a burned leaf of mistletoe and a sprig of spruce)
level_2.description: A veil of shadows and silence radiates from you, masking you and your companions from detection. For the duration, each creature you choose within 30 feet of you has a +10 bonus to Dexterity (Stealth) checks and can't be tracked except by magical means. A creature that receives this bonus leaves behind no tracks or other traces of its passage.

level_2.name: Phantasmal Force
level_2.components: V, S, M (a bit of fleece)
level_2.description: You craft an illusion that takes root in the mind of a creature you can see within range. The target must make an Intelligence saving throw. On a failed save, you create a phantasmal object, creature, or other visible phenomenon of your choice that is no larger than a 10-foot cube. The target rationalizes any illogical results and takes 1d6 psychic damage each turn from the phantasm. The target can use an action to make an Investigation check against your spell DC to disbelieve.

level_2.name: Prayer of Healing
level_2.components: V
level_2.description: Up to six creatures of your choice that you can see within range each regain hit points equal to 2d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs. At higher levels: the healing increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 2nd.

level_2.name: Protection from Poison
level_2.components: V, S
level_2.description: You touch a creature. If it is poisoned, you neutralize the poison. If more than one poison afflicts the target, you neutralize one poison that you know is present. For the duration, the target has advantage on saving throws against being poisoned and has resistance to poison damage.

level_2.name: Ray of Enfeeblement
level_2.components: V, S
level_2.description: A black beam of enervating energy springs from your finger toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target deals only half damage with weapon attacks that use Strength until the spell ends. At the end of each of the target's turns, it can make a Constitution saving throw to end the spell.

level_2.name: Rope Trick
level_2.components: V, S, M (powdered corn extract and a twisted loop of parchment)
level_2.description: You touch a length of rope that is up to 60 feet long. One end of the rope rises into the air until the whole rope hangs perpendicular to the ground. At the upper end of the rope, an invisible entrance opens to an extradimensional space that lasts for the duration. Up to eight Medium or smaller creatures can be in the extradimensional space. Attacks and spells can't cross through the entrance.

level_2.name: Scorching Ray
level_2.components: V, S
level_2.description: You create three rays of fire and hurl them at targets within range. You can hurl them at one target or several. Make a ranged spell attack for each ray. On a hit, the target takes 2d6 fire damage. At higher levels: create one additional ray for each slot level above 2nd.

level_2.name: See Invisibility
level_2.components: V, S, M (a pinch of talc and a small sprinkling of powdered silver)
level_2.description: For the duration, you see invisible creatures and objects as if they were visible, and you can see into the Ethereal Plane. Ethereal creatures and objects appear ghostly and translucent.

level_2.name: Shatter
level_2.components: V, S, M (a chip of mica)
level_2.description: A sudden loud ringing noise, painfully intense, erupts from a point of your choice within range. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere must make a Constitution saving throw. A creature takes 3d8 thunder damage on a failed save, or half on success. A creature made of inorganic material (stone, crystal, metal) has disadvantage on the save. A nonmagical object not worn or carried also takes damage. At higher levels: damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 2nd.

level_2.name: Silence
level_2.components: V, S
level_2.description: For the duration, no sound can be created within or pass through a 20-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose within range. Any creature or object entirely inside the sphere is immune to thunder damage, and creatures are deafened while entirely inside it. Casting a spell that includes a verbal component is impossible within the sphere.

level_2.name: Spider Climb
level_2.components: V, S, M (a drop of bitumen and a spider)
level_2.description: Until the spell ends, one willing creature you touch gains the ability to move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and upside down along ceilings, while leaving its hands free. The target also gains a climbing speed equal to its walking speed.

level_2.name: Spike Growth
level_2.components: V, S, M (seven sharp thorns or seven small twigs, each sharpened to a point)
level_2.description: The ground in a 20-foot radius centered on a point within range twists and sprouts hard spikes and thorns. The area becomes difficult terrain. When a creature moves into or within the area, it takes 2d4 piercing damage for every 5 feet it travels. The transformation is camouflaged to look natural. A creature that can't see the area must make a Perception check against your spell save DC to recognize it as hazardous.

level_2.name: Spiritual Weapon
level_2.components: V, S
level_2.description: You create a floating, spectral weapon within range that lasts for the duration. When you cast the spell, you can make a melee spell attack against a creature within 5 feet of the weapon. On a hit, the target takes force damage equal to 1d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier. As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the weapon up to 20 feet and repeat the attack. At higher levels: damage increases by 1d8 for every two slot levels above 2nd.

level_2.name: Suggestion
level_2.components: V, M (a snake's tongue and either a bit of honeycomb or a drop of sweet oil)
level_2.description: You suggest a course of activity (limited to a sentence or two) and magically influence a creature you can see within range that can hear and understand you. The suggestion must be worded to sound reasonable. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, it pursues the course of action you described to the best of its ability. The activity can last for the entire duration.

level_2.name: Warding Bond
level_2.components: V, S, M (a pair of platinum rings worth at least 50 gp each, which you and the target must wear for the duration)
level_2.description: This spell wards a willing creature you touch and creates a mystic connection between you. Until the spell ends, the target has +1 to AC and saving throws and has resistance to all damage. Each time the target takes damage, you take the same amount of damage. The spell ends if you drop to 0 HP or if the target moves more than 60 feet from you.

level_2.name: Web
level_2.components: V, S, M (a bit of spiderweb)
level_2.description: You conjure a mass of thick, sticky webbing at a point of your choice within range. The webs fill a 20-foot cube. The webs are difficult terrain and lightly obscure the area. A creature that starts its turn in the webs or enters them must make a Dexterity saving throw or be restrained. A restrained creature can use its action to make a Strength check against your spell save DC to free itself. The webs are flammable (5-foot cube burns away in 1 round, dealing 2d4 fire damage to any creature starting its turn in the fire).

level_2.name: Zone of Truth
level_2.components: V, S
level_2.description: You create a magical zone that guards against deception in a 15-foot-radius sphere centered on a point of your choice. A creature that enters the area must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failed save, a creature can't speak a deliberate lie. An affected creature is aware of the spell and can avoid answering questions it would normally respond to with a lie. You know whether each creature succeeded or failed on its saving throw.

level_3.name: Animate Dead
level_3.components: V, S, M (a drop of blood, a piece of flesh, and a pinch of bone dust)
level_3.description: This spell creates an undead servant. Choose a pile of bones or a corpse of a Medium or Small humanoid within range. Your spell imbues the target with a foul mimicry of life, raising it as a skeleton (from bones) or a zombie (from a corpse). On each of your turns, you can use a bonus action to mentally command any creature you made with this spell within 60 feet. You must recast this spell within 24 hours to maintain control. At higher levels: animate or reassert control over two additional undead for each slot level above 3rd.

level_3.name: Aura of Vitality
level_3.components: V
level_3.description: Healing energy radiates from you in an aura with a 30-foot radius. Until the spell ends, the aura moves with you. You can use a bonus action to cause one creature in the aura (including you) to regain 2d6 hit points.

level_3.name: Beacon of Hope
level_3.components: V, S
level_3.description: This spell bestows hope and vitality. Choose any number of creatures within range. For the duration, each target has advantage on Wisdom saving throws and death saving throws, and regains the maximum number of hit points possible from any healing.

level_3.name: Bestow Curse
level_3.components: V, S
level_3.description: You touch a creature, and that creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become cursed for the duration. Choose one: disadvantage on checks and saves with one ability score; disadvantage on attack rolls against you; Wisdom save each turn or waste its action; or your attacks and spells deal an extra 1d8 necrotic damage to the target. At higher levels: duration increases (4th: 10 min, 5th: 8 hours, 7th: 24 hours, 9th: permanent).

level_3.name: Blinding Smite
level_3.components: V
level_3.description: The next time you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack during this spell's duration, your weapon flares with bright light, and the attack deals an extra 3d8 radiant damage to the target. The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or be blinded until the spell ends. A blinded creature can make a Constitution saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on a success.

level_3.name: Blink
level_3.components: V, S
level_3.description: Roll a d20 at the end of each of your turns for the duration of the spell. On a roll of 11 or higher, you vanish from your current plane of existence and appear in the Ethereal Plane. At the start of your next turn, you return to an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within 10 feet of where you vanished. While on the Ethereal Plane, you can see and hear the plane you originated from (grayed out to 60 feet) but can't affect or be affected by anything on the other plane.

level_3.name: Call Lightning
level_3.components: V, S
level_3.description: A storm cloud appears in the shape of a cylinder 10 feet tall with a 60-foot radius, centered on a point you can see 100 feet directly above you. When you cast the spell, choose a point you can see under the cloud. A bolt of lightning flashes down, and each creature within 5 feet of that point must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 3d10 lightning damage on a failed save, or half on success. On each of your turns, you can use your action to call down another bolt. If you are outdoors in stormy conditions, the damage increases by 1d10. At higher levels: damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 3rd.

level_3.name: Clairvoyance
level_3.components: V, S, M (a focus worth at least 100 gp — either a jeweled horn for hearing or a glass eye for seeing)
level_3.description: You create an invisible sensor within range in a location familiar to you or in an obvious location unfamiliar to you. The sensor can't be attacked or interacted with. When you cast the spell, you choose seeing or hearing. You can use the chosen sense through the sensor as if you were in its space. As your action, you can switch between seeing and hearing.

level_3.name: Conjure Animals
level_3.components: V, S
level_3.description: You summon fey spirits that take the form of beasts. Choose one of the following options: one beast of challenge rating 2 or lower, two beasts of CR 1 or lower, four beasts of CR 1/2 or lower, or eight beasts of CR 1/4 or lower. Each beast is also considered fey, and it disappears when it drops to 0 HP or when the spell ends. The summoned creatures are friendly to you and your companions and act on your initiative. At higher levels: summon twice as many creatures at 5th level, three times as many at 7th, four times as many at 9th.

level_3.name: Conjure Barrage
level_3.components: V, S, M (one piece of ammunition or a thrown weapon)
level_3.description: You throw a nonmagical weapon or fire a piece of nonmagical ammunition into the air to create a cone of identical weapons that shoot forward. Each creature in a 60-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 3d8 damage on a failed save, or half on success. The damage type is the same as that of the weapon or ammunition used as a component.

level_3.name: Counterspell
level_3.casting_time: 1 reaction (when you see a creature within 60 feet of you casting a spell)
level_3.components: S
level_3.description: You attempt to interrupt a creature in the process of casting a spell. If the creature is casting a spell of 3rd level or lower, its spell fails and has no effect. If it is casting a spell of 4th level or higher, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a success, the creature's spell fails. At higher levels: the interrupted spell has no effect if its level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you used.

level_3.name: Create Food and Water
level_3.components: V, S
level_3.description: You create 45 pounds of food and 30 gallons of water on the ground or in containers within range, enough to sustain up to fifteen humanoids or five steeds for 24 hours. The food is bland but nourishing, and spoils if uneaten after 24 hours. The water is clean and doesn't go bad.

level_3.name: Crusader's Mantle
level_3.components: V
level_3.description: Holy power radiates from you in an aura with a 30-foot radius, awakening boldness in friendly creatures. Until the spell ends, the aura moves with you. While in the aura, each nonhostile creature in the aura (including you) deals an extra 1d4 radiant damage when it hits with a weapon attack.

level_3.name: Daylight
level_3.components: V, S
level_3.description: A 60-foot-radius sphere of light spreads out from a point you choose within range. The sphere is bright light and sheds dim light for an additional 60 feet. If the point you chose is on an object you are holding or one that isn't being worn or carried, the light shines from and moves with the object. Completely covering the object with an opaque container blocks the light. If any of this spell's area overlaps with darkness created by a spell of 3rd level or lower, the darkness spell is dispelled.

level_3.name: Dispel Magic
level_3.components: V, S
level_3.description: Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within range. Any spell of 3rd level or lower on the target ends. For each spell of 4th level or higher on the target, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a successful check, the spell ends. At higher levels: you automatically end the effects of a spell on the target if the spell's level is equal to or less than the level of the spell slot you used.

level_3.name: Elemental Weapon
level_3.components: V, S
level_3.description: A nonmagical weapon you touch becomes a magic weapon. Choose one of the following damage types: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder. For the duration, the weapon has a +1 bonus to attack rolls and deals an extra 1d4 damage of the chosen type when it hits. At higher levels: +2 bonus and 2d4 extra damage at 5th–6th level, +3 bonus and 3d4 extra damage at 7th level or higher.

level_3.name: Fear
level_3.components: V, S, M (a white feather or the heart of a hen)
level_3.description: You project a phantasmal image of a creature's worst fears. Each creature in a 30-foot cone must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or drop whatever it is holding and become frightened for the duration. A frightened creature must use its turn to move as far as possible away from you by the safest route. If it ends its turn in a location where it doesn't have line of sight to you, it can make a Wisdom saving throw to end the effect.

level_3.name: Feign Death
level_3.components: V, S, M (a pinch of graveyard dirt)
level_3.description: You touch a willing creature and put it into a cataleptic state that is indistinguishable from death. For the duration, the target appears dead to all outward inspection and to spells used to determine the target's status. The target is blinded and incapacitated, speed drops to 0, and it has resistance to all damage except psychic damage. If the target is diseased or poisoned, or becomes so during the spell, the disease and poison have no effect until the spell ends.

level_3.name: Fireball
level_3.components: V, S, M (a tiny ball of bat guano and sulfur)
level_3.description: A bright streak flashes from your pointing finger to a point you choose within range and then blossoms with a low roar into an explosion of flame. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere must make a Dexterity saving throw. A target takes 8d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. The fire spreads around corners. It ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried. At higher levels: damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

level_3.name: Fly
level_3.components: V, S, M (a wing feather from any bird)
level_3.description: You touch a willing creature. The target gains a flying speed of 60 feet for the duration. When the spell ends, the target falls if it is still aloft, unless it can stop the fall. At higher levels: target one additional creature for each slot level above 3rd.

level_3.name: Gaseous Form
level_3.components: V, S, M (a bit of gauze and a wisp of smoke)
level_3.description: You transform a willing creature you touch, along with everything it's wearing and carrying, into a misty cloud for the duration. The spell ends if the creature drops to 0 HP. The creature has a flying speed of 10 feet, can hover, can pass through small holes and cracks. The target has resistance to nonmagical damage, advantage on STR, DEX, and CON saving throws, and can't talk, manipulate objects, attack, or cast spells.

level_3.name: Glyph of Warding
level_3.components: V, S, M (incense and powdered diamond worth at least 200 gp, which the spell consumes)
level_3.description: You inscribe a glyph on a surface or within an object that can be closed to conceal the glyph. The glyph covers an area no larger than 10 feet in diameter. When triggered, the glyph can either explode (5d8 acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder damage in a 20-foot-radius sphere, DEX save for half) or store a spell of 3rd level or lower that targets a single creature or an area. An Investigation check against your spell save DC reveals the glyph.

level_3.name: Haste
level_3.components: V, S, M (a shaving of licorice root)
level_3.description: Choose a willing creature that you can see within range. Until the spell ends, the target's speed is doubled, it gains a +2 bonus to AC, it has advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and it gains an additional action on each of its turns (Attack — one weapon attack only, Dash, Disengage, Hide, or Use an Object). When the spell ends, the target can't move or take actions until after its next turn, as a wave of lethargy sweeps over it.

level_3.name: Hunger of Hadar
level_3.components: V, S, M (a pickled octopus tentacle)
level_3.description: You open a gateway to the dark between the stars, a region infested with unknown horrors. A 20-foot-radius sphere of blackness and bitter cold appears, centered on a point with range. The void is filled with a cacophony of soft whispers and slurping noises. No light, magical or otherwise, can illuminate the area, and creatures inside are blinded. Any creature that starts its turn in the area takes 2d6 cold damage. Any creature that ends its turn there must make a DEX save or take 2d6 acid damage.

level_3.name: Hypnotic Pattern
level_3.components: S, M (a glowing stick of incense or a crystal vial filled with phosphorescent material)
level_3.description: You create a twisting pattern of colors that weaves through the air inside a 30-foot cube within range. The pattern appears for a moment and vanishes. Each creature in the area who sees the pattern must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature becomes charmed for the duration. While charmed, the creature is incapacitated and has a speed of 0. The effect ends for an affected creature if it takes any damage or if someone else uses an action to shake the creature out of its stupor.

level_3.name: Leomund's Tiny Hut
level_3.components: V, S, M (a small crystal bead)
level_3.description: A 10-foot-radius immobile dome of force springs into existence around and above you, remaining stationary for the duration. The interior is comfortable and dry. The spell ends if you leave its area. Up to nine Medium creatures can fit inside. Creatures and objects within the dome when you cast this spell can move through it freely. All other creatures and objects are barred from passing through. Spells can't extend through the dome. The atmosphere inside is comfortable regardless of outside conditions.

level_3.name: Lightning Bolt
level_3.components: V, S, M (a bit of fur and a rod of amber, crystal, or glass)
level_3.description: A stroke of lightning forming a line 100 feet long and 5 feet wide blasts out from you in a direction you choose. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 8d6 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. The lightning ignites flammable objects in the area that aren't being worn or carried. At higher levels: damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

level_3.name: Magic Circle
level_3.components: V, S, M (holy water or powdered silver and iron worth at least 100 gp, which the spell consumes)
level_3.description: You create a 10-foot-radius, 20-foot-tall cylinder of magical energy centered on a point on the ground that you can see. Choose one or more creature types: celestials, elementals, fey, fiends, or undead. The circle affects a creature of the chosen type in the following ways: the creature can't willingly enter the cylinder, the creature has disadvantage on attack rolls against targets within the cylinder, and targets within the cylinder can't be charmed, frightened, or possessed by the creature. You can also invert the effect to trap such creatures inside.

level_3.name: Major Image
level_3.components: V, S, M (a bit of fleece)
level_3.description: You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 20-foot cube. The image appears at a spot within range and lasts for the duration. It seems completely real, including sounds, smells, and temperature appropriate to the thing depicted. You can use your action to cause the image to move, change, and interact with the environment. An Investigation check against your spell save DC reveals it as an illusion. At 6th level: lasts until dispelled without concentration.

level_3.name: Mass Healing Word
level_3.components: V
level_3.description: As you call out words of restoration, up to six creatures of your choice that you can see within range regain hit points equal to 1d4 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs. At higher levels: the healing increases by 1d4 for each slot level above 3rd.

level_3.name: Meld into Stone
level_3.components: V, S
level_3.description: You step into a stone object or surface large enough to fully contain your body, melding yourself and all the equipment you carry with the stone for the duration. You can use your movement to leave the stone where you entered, which ends the spell. You can't see what occurs outside the stone but are aware of the passage of time. Minor damage to the stone doesn't harm you, but partial destruction or changing its shape to where you no longer fit expels you and deals 6d6 bludgeoning damage.

level_3.name: Nondetection
level_3.components: V, S, M (a pinch of diamond dust worth 25 gp sprinkled over the target, which the spell consumes)
level_3.description: For the duration, you hide a target that you touch from divination magic. The target can be a willing creature or a place or an object no larger than 10 feet in any dimension. The target can't be targeted by any divination magic or perceived through magical scrying sensors.

level_3.name: Phantom Steed
level_3.components: V, S
level_3.description: A Large quasi-real, horselike creature appears on the ground in an unoccupied space of your choice within range. You decide the creature's appearance, but it has the statistics of a riding horse. The creature has a speed of 100 feet and can travel 10 miles in an hour, or 13 miles at a fast pace. The creature disappears if it takes any damage or if you dismiss it as an action. It fades over 1 minute, giving the rider time to dismount.

level_3.name: Plant Growth
level_3.components: V, S
level_3.description: This spell channels vitality into plants within a specific area. If cast using 1 action, choose a point within range. All normal plants in a 100-foot radius become thick and overgrown, making the area difficult terrain (costs 4 feet of movement per 1 foot). If cast over 8 hours, you enrich the land: for 1 year, plants in a half-mile radius yield twice the normal amount of food when harvested.

level_3.name: Protection from Energy
level_3.components: V, S
level_3.description: For the duration, the willing creature you touch has resistance to one damage type of your choice: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder.

level_3.name: Remove Curse
level_3.components: V, S
level_3.description: At your touch, all curses affecting one creature or object end. If the object is a cursed magic item, its curse remains, but the spell breaks its owner's attunement to the object so it can be removed or discarded.

level_3.name: Revivify
level_3.components: V, S, M (diamonds worth 300 gp, which the spell consumes)
level_3.description: You touch a creature that has died within the last minute. That creature returns to life with 1 hit point. This spell can't return to life a creature that has died of old age, nor can it restore any missing body parts.

level_3.name: Sending
level_3.components: V, S, M (a short piece of fine copper wire)
level_3.description: You send a short message of twenty-five words or less to a creature with which you are familiar. The creature hears the message in its mind, recognizes you as the sender if it knows you, and can answer in a like manner immediately. You can send the message across any distance and even to other planes of existence, but there is a 5 percent chance of failure if the target is on a different plane.

level_3.name: Sleet Storm
level_3.components: V, S, M (a pinch of dust and a few drops of water)
level_3.description: Until the spell ends, freezing rain and sleet fall in a 20-foot-tall cylinder with a 40-foot radius centered on a point you choose within range. The area is heavily obscured, and exposed flames in the area are doused. The ground in the area is covered with slick ice, making it difficult terrain. When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Dexterity saving throw or fall prone. A creature concentrating in the area must make a Constitution saving throw or lose concentration.

level_3.name: Slow
level_3.components: V, S, M (a drop of molasses)
level_3.description: You alter time around up to six creatures of your choice in a 40-foot cube within range. Each target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be affected: speed halved, −2 to AC and Dexterity saves, no reactions, only one attack per turn regardless of abilities, and if it casts a spell with a casting time of 1 action, roll a d20 — on 11 or higher, the spell takes effect next turn instead. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns.

level_3.name: Speak with Dead
level_3.components: V, S, M (burning incense)
level_3.description: You grant the semblance of life and intelligence to a corpse of your choice within range, allowing it to answer up to five questions during the duration. The corpse must still have a mouth and can't be undead. Answers are usually brief, cryptic, or repetitive, and the corpse has no obligation to offer a truthful answer. This spell doesn't return the creature's soul to its body.

level_3.name: Speak with Plants
level_3.components: V, S
level_3.description: You imbue plants within 30 feet of you with limited sentience and animation, giving them the ability to communicate with you and follow your simple commands. You can question plants about events in the spell's area within the past day, gaining information about creatures that have passed, weather, and other circumstances. You can also turn difficult terrain caused by plant growth into ordinary terrain for the duration, or turn ordinary terrain into difficult terrain.

level_3.name: Spirit Guardians
level_3.components: V, S, M (a holy symbol)
level_3.description: You call forth spirits to protect you. They flit around you to a distance of 15 feet for the duration. If you are good or neutral, their spectral form appears angelic or fey. If you are evil, they appear fiendish. When you cast this spell, you can designate any number of creatures to be unaffected. An affected creature's speed is halved in the area, and when it enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a Wisdom saving throw, taking 3d8 radiant (good/neutral) or necrotic (evil) damage on a failed save, or half on success. At higher levels: damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 3rd.

level_3.name: Stinking Cloud
level_3.components: V, S, M (a rotten egg or several skunk cabbage leaves)
level_3.description: You create a 20-foot-radius sphere of yellow, nauseating gas centered on a point within range. The cloud spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. The cloud lingers in the air for the duration. Each creature that is completely within the cloud at the start of its turn must make a Constitution saving throw against poison. On a failed save, the creature spends its action that turn retching and reeling. Creatures that don't need to breathe or are immune to poison automatically succeed.

level_3.name: Tongues
level_3.components: V, M (a small clay model of a ziggurat)
level_3.description: This spell grants the creature you touch the ability to understand any spoken language it hears. Moreover, when the target speaks, any creature that knows at least one language and can hear the target understands what it says.

level_3.name: Vampiric Touch
level_3.components: V, S
level_3.description: The touch of your shadow-wreathed hand can siphon life force from others to heal your wounds. Make a melee spell attack against a creature within your reach. On a hit, the target takes 3d6 necrotic damage, and you regain hit points equal to half the amount of necrotic damage dealt. Until the spell ends, you can make the attack again on each of your turns as an action. At higher levels: damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 3rd.

level_3.name: Water Breathing
level_3.components: V, S, M (a short reed or piece of straw)
level_3.description: This spell grants up to ten willing creatures you can see within range the ability to breathe underwater until the spell ends. Affected creatures also retain their normal mode of respiration.

level_3.name: Water Walk
level_3.components: V, S, M (a piece of cork)
level_3.description: This spell grants the ability to move across any liquid surface — such as water, acid, mud, snow, quicksand, or lava — as if it were harmless solid ground (creatures crossing molten lava can still take damage from the heat). Up to ten willing creatures you can see within range gain this ability for the duration. If you target a creature submerged in a liquid, the spell carries the target to the surface at a rate of 60 feet per round.

level_3.name: Wind Wall
level_3.components: V, S, M (a tiny fan and a feather of exotic origin)
level_3.description: A wall of strong wind rises from the ground at a point you choose within range. You can make the wall up to 50 feet long, 15 feet high, and 1 foot thick, or you can shape it in a ringed wall up to 20 feet in diameter, 15 feet high, and 1 foot thick. Each creature in the area when the wall appears must make a Strength saving throw, taking 3d8 bludgeoning damage on a failed save, or half on success. The strong wind keeps fog, smoke, and other gases at bay. Small or lighter flying creatures or objects can't pass through the wall. Arrows and bolts are deflected upward and automatically miss.

level_4.name: Arcane Eye
level_4.components: V, S, M (a bit of bat fur)
level_4.description: You create an invisible, magical eye within range that hovers in the air for the duration. You mentally receive visual information from the eye, which has normal vision and darkvision out to 30 feet. The eye can look in every direction. As an action, you can move the eye up to 30 feet in any direction. It can pass through openings as small as 1 inch in diameter.

level_4.name: Aura of Life
level_4.components: V
level_4.description: Life-preserving energy radiates from you in an aura with a 30-foot radius. Until the spell ends, the aura moves with you. Each nonhostile creature in the aura (including you) has resistance to necrotic damage, and its hit point maximum can't be reduced. In addition, a nonhostile living creature regains 1 hit point when it starts its turn in the aura with 0 hit points.

level_4.name: Aura of Purity
level_4.components: V
level_4.description: Purifying energy radiates from you in an aura with a 30-foot radius. Until the spell ends, the aura moves with you. Each nonhostile creature in the aura (including you) can't become diseased, has resistance to poison damage, and has advantage on saving throws against effects that cause any of the following conditions: blinded, charmed, deafened, frightened, paralyzed, poisoned, and stunned.

level_4.name: Banishment
level_4.components: V, S, M (an item distasteful to the target)
level_4.description: You attempt to send one creature that you can see within range to another plane of existence. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be banished. If the target is native to the plane you're on, it is banished to a harmless demiplane and is incapacitated there. If the target is native to a different plane, it is banished with a faint popping noise, returning to its home plane. If the spell lasts for the full duration, the target doesn't return (if from another plane). At higher levels: target one additional creature for each slot level above 4th.

level_4.name: Blight
level_4.components: V, S
level_4.description: Necromantic energy washes over a creature of your choice that you can see within range, draining moisture and vitality from it. The target must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 8d8 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half on success. This spell has no effect on undead or constructs. A plant creature or a magical plant makes the saving throw with disadvantage and takes maximum damage. A nonmagical plant that isn't a creature simply withers and dies. At higher levels: damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 4th.

level_4.name: Compulsion
level_4.components: V, S
level_4.description: Creatures of your choice that you can see within range and that can hear you must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a target is affected by this spell. Until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action on each of your turns to designate a direction that is horizontal to you. Each affected target must use as much of its movement as possible to move in that direction on its next turn. A creature can repeat the saving throw at the end of each of its turns.

level_4.name: Confusion
level_4.components: V, S, M (three nut shells)
level_4.description: This spell assaults and twists creatures' minds, spawning delusions and provoking uncontrolled action. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere centered on a point you choose must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be affected. An affected target can't take reactions and must roll a d10 at the start of each of its turns: 1 = move randomly, 2–6 = no action or movement, 7–8 = melee attack a random adjacent creature, 9–10 = act normally. An affected creature can repeat the save at the end of each of its turns. At higher levels: the radius increases by 5 feet for each slot level above 4th.

level_4.name: Conjure Minor Elementals
level_4.components: V, S
level_4.description: You summon elementals that appear in unoccupied spaces that you can see within range. Choose one of the following options: one elemental of CR 2 or lower, two elementals of CR 1 or lower, four elementals of CR 1/2 or lower, or eight elementals of CR 1/4 or lower. An elemental summoned by this spell disappears when it drops to 0 HP or when the spell ends. The summoned creatures are friendly to you and your companions and obey your verbal commands. At higher levels: summon twice as many at 6th level, three times as many at 8th.

level_4.name: Conjure Woodland Beings
level_4.components: V, S, M (one holly berry per creature summoned)
level_4.description: You summon fey creatures that appear in unoccupied spaces that you can see within range. Choose one of the following options: one fey creature of CR 2 or lower, two fey creatures of CR 1 or lower, four fey creatures of CR 1/2 or lower, or eight fey creatures of CR 1/4 or lower. A summoned creature disappears when it drops to 0 HP or when the spell ends. The summoned creatures are friendly to you and your companions. At higher levels: summon twice as many at 6th level, three times as many at 8th.

level_4.name: Control Water
level_4.components: V, S, M (a drop of water and a pinch of dust)
level_4.description: Until the spell ends, you control any freestanding water inside an area you choose that is a cube up to 100 feet on a side. Choose one of the following effects: Flood (raise water level up to 20 feet, flooding the area), Part Water (create a trench up to 100 feet long through the area), Redirect Flow (cause flowing water to move in a direction you choose), or Whirlpool (a vortex 50 feet deep, 5-foot wide, pulling creatures: STR save or 2d8 bludgeoning damage and pulled 10 feet toward center).

level_4.name: Death Ward
level_4.components: V, S
level_4.description: You touch a creature and grant it a measure of protection from death. The first time the target would drop to 0 hit points as a result of taking damage, the target instead drops to 1 hit point, and the spell ends. If the spell is still in effect when the target is subjected to an effect that would kill it instantaneously without dealing damage, that effect is negated against the target, and the spell ends.

level_4.name: Dimension Door
level_4.components: V
level_4.description: You teleport yourself from your current location to any other spot within range. You arrive at exactly the spot desired. It can be a place you can see, one you can visualize, or one you can describe by stating distance and direction. You can bring along objects as long as their weight doesn't exceed what you can carry. You can also bring one willing creature of your size or smaller who is carrying gear up to its carrying capacity. If you would arrive in an occupied space, you and any creature traveling with you each take 4d6 force damage and the teleportation fails.

level_4.name: Divination
level_4.components: V, S, M (incense and a sacrificial offering appropriate to your religion, together worth at least 25 gp, which the spell consumes)
level_4.description: Your magic and an offering put you in contact with a god or a god's servants. You ask a single question concerning a specific goal, event, or activity to occur within 7 days. The DM offers a truthful reply, which might be a short phrase, a cryptic rhyme, or an omen. The spell doesn't account for possible circumstances that might change the outcome. Successive castings before a long rest have a cumulative 25% chance of giving a random reading.

level_4.name: Dominate Beast
level_4.components: V, S
level_4.description: You attempt to beguile a beast that you can see within range. It must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by you for the duration. If you or your companions are fighting it, it has advantage on the save. While charmed, you have a telepathic link with it. You can use your action to take total and precise control of the target. Each time it takes damage, it makes a new Wisdom saving throw. At higher levels: duration increases (5th: 10 min, 6th: 1 hour, 7th+: 8 hours).

level_4.name: Evard's Black Tentacles
level_4.components: V, S, M (a piece of tentacle from a giant octopus or a giant squid)
level_4.description: Squirming, ebony tentacles fill a 20-foot square on ground that you can see within range. For the duration, these tentacles turn the ground in the area into difficult terrain. When a creature enters the affected area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, the creature must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 3d6 bludgeoning damage and be restrained by the tentacles until the spell ends. A creature restrained can use its action to make a Strength or Dexterity check against your spell save DC to free itself.

level_4.name: Fabricate
level_4.components: V, S
level_4.description: You convert raw materials into products of the same material. For example, you can fabricate a wooden bridge from a clump of trees, a rope from a patch of hemp, and clothes from flax or wool. Choose raw materials that you can see within range. You can fabricate a Large or smaller object (contained within a 10-foot cube) or up to a 5-foot cube per caster level of objects. If you are working with metal, stone, or another mineral substance, the fabricated object can be no larger than Medium (contained within a single 5-foot cube). You must have proficiency with the relevant artisan's tools.

level_4.name: Fire Shield
level_4.components: V, S, M (a bit of phosphorus or a firefly)
level_4.description: Thin and wispy flames wreathe your body for the duration, shedding bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. You can end the spell early as an action. The flames provide you with a warm shield or a chill shield, as you choose. The warm shield grants resistance to cold damage, and the chill shield grants resistance to fire damage. In addition, whenever a creature within 5 feet of you hits you with a melee attack, the shield erupts with flame. The attacker takes 2d8 fire damage (warm) or 2d8 cold damage (chill).

level_4.name: Freedom of Movement
level_4.components: V, S, M (a leather strap, bound around the arm or a similar appendage)
level_4.description: You touch a willing creature. For the duration, the target's movement is unaffected by difficult terrain, and spells and other magical effects can neither reduce the target's speed nor cause the target to be paralyzed or restrained. The target can also spend 5 feet of movement to automatically escape from nonmagical restraints. Being underwater imposes no penalties on the target's movement or attacks.

level_4.name: Giant Insect
level_4.components: V, S
level_4.description: You transform up to ten centipedes, three spiders, five wasps, or one scorpion within range into giant versions of their natural forms for the duration. A centipede becomes a giant centipede, a spider becomes a giant spider, a wasp becomes a giant wasp, and a scorpion becomes a giant scorpion. Each creature obeys your verbal commands. In combat, they act on your turn each round. The DM has the statistics for these creatures.

level_4.name: Greater Invisibility
level_4.components: V, S
level_4.description: You or a creature you touch becomes invisible until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is invisible as long as it is on the target's person. Unlike regular Invisibility, the target does NOT become visible when it attacks or casts a spell.

level_4.name: Guardian of Faith
level_4.components: V
level_4.description: A Large spectral guardian appears and hovers for the duration in an unoccupied space of your choice that you can see within range. The guardian occupies that space and is indistinct except for a gleaming sword and shield emblazoned with the symbol of your deity. Any creature hostile to you that moves to a space within 10 feet of the guardian for the first time on a turn must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or take 20 radiant damage. On a success, it takes half damage. The guardian vanishes when it has dealt a total of 60 damage.

level_4.name: Hallucinatory Terrain
level_4.components: V, S, M (a stone, a twig, and a bit of green plant)
level_4.description: You make natural terrain in a 150-foot cube in range look, sound, and smell like some other sort of natural terrain. Open fields or a road can be made to resemble a swamp, hill, crevasse, or some other difficult or impassable terrain. A pond can be made to seem like a grassy meadow. Manufactured structures, equipment, and creatures within the area aren't changed. The tactile characteristics of the terrain are unchanged. An Investigation check against your spell save DC reveals it as an illusion.

level_4.name: Ice Storm
level_4.components: V, S, M (a pinch of dust and a few drops of water)
level_4.description: A hail of rock-hard ice pounds to the ground in a 20-foot-radius, 40-foot-high cylinder centered on a point within range. Each creature in the cylinder must make a Dexterity saving throw. A creature takes 2d8 bludgeoning damage and 4d6 cold damage on a failed save, or half as much on a successful one. Hailstones turn the storm's area of effect into difficult terrain until the end of your next turn. At higher levels: bludgeoning damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 4th.

level_4.name: Leomund's Secret Chest
level_4.components: V, S, M (an exquisite chest, 3 ft. by 2 ft. by 2 ft., constructed from rare materials worth at least 5,000 gp, and a Tiny replica made from the same materials worth at least 50 gp)
level_4.description: You hide a chest, and all its contents, on the Ethereal Plane. You must touch the chest and the miniature replica that serves as a material component. The chest can contain up to 12 cubic feet of nonliving material. While the chest is on the Ethereal Plane, you can use an action and touch the replica to recall the chest. It appears in an unoccupied space on the ground within 5 feet of you. You can send the chest back by using an action and touching both the chest and the replica. After 60 days, there is a cumulative 5% chance per day that the spell's effect ends.

level_4.name: Locate Creature
level_4.components: V, S, M (a bit of fur from a bloodhound)
level_4.description: Describe or name a creature that is familiar to you. You sense the direction to the creature's location, as long as that creature is within 1,000 feet of you. If the creature is moving, you know the direction of its movement. The spell can locate a specific creature known to you, or the nearest creature of a specific kind. Running water at least 10 feet wide blocks this spell. The spell can't locate a creature if it has been polymorphed.

level_4.name: Mordenkainen's Faithful Hound
level_4.components: V, S, M (a tiny silver whistle, a piece of bone, and a thread)
level_4.description: You conjure a phantom watchdog in an unoccupied space that you can see within range, where it remains for the duration, until you dismiss it as an action, or until you move more than 100 feet from it. The hound is invisible to all creatures except you and can't be harmed. When a Small or larger creature comes within 30 feet of it without first speaking the password that you specify, the hound starts barking loudly. The hound sees invisible creatures and can see into the Ethereal Plane. It ignores illusions. At the start of each of your turns, the hound attempts to bite one creature within 5 feet of it that is hostile to you: +the hound's attack bonus, dealing 4d8 piercing damage on a hit.

level_4.name: Mordenkainen's Private Sanctum
level_4.components: V, S, M (a thin sheet of lead, a piece of opaque glass, a wad of cotton or cloth, and powdered chrysolite)
level_4.description: You make an area within range magically secure. The area is a cube, from as small as 5 feet to as large as 100 feet on each side. You decide what the security consists of, choosing from: sound can't pass through the barrier, the barrier is opaque (dark and foggy), divination spells can't target anything in the area, creatures can't teleport into the area, and planar travel is blocked. Casting this spell in the same location every day for a year makes it permanent.

level_4.name: Otiluke's Resilient Sphere
level_4.components: V, S, M (a hemispherical piece of clear crystal and a matching hemispherical piece of gum arabic)
level_4.description: A sphere of shimmering force encloses a creature or object of Large size or smaller within range. An unwilling creature must make a Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is enclosed for the duration. Nothing — not physical objects, energy, or other spell effects — can pass through the barrier, in or out, though a creature in the sphere can breathe there. The sphere is immune to all damage, and a creature or object inside can't be damaged by attacks or effects originating from outside, nor can a creature inside damage anything outside. The sphere is weightless and can be pushed at up to half your speed.

level_4.name: Phantasmal Killer
level_4.components: V, S
level_4.description: You tap into the nightmares of a creature you can see within range and create an illusory manifestation of its deepest fears, visible only to that creature. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the target becomes frightened for the duration. At the end of each of the target's turns, the target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take 4d10 psychic damage. On a successful save, the spell ends. At higher levels: damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 4th.

level_4.name: Polymorph
level_4.components: V, S, M (a caterpillar cocoon)
level_4.description: This spell transforms a creature that you can see within range into a new form. An unwilling creature must make a Wisdom saving throw. A shapechanger succeeds automatically. The target's game statistics, including mental ability scores, are replaced by the statistics of the chosen beast. It retains its alignment and personality. The target assumes the hit points of its new form. When it reverts to its normal form, the creature returns to the number of hit points it had before it transformed. If it reverts as a result of dropping to 0 HP, any excess damage carries over. The new form's CR must be equal to or less than the target's level (or CR).

level_4.name: Staggering Smite
level_4.components: V
level_4.description: The next time you hit a creature with a melee weapon attack during this spell's duration, your weapon pierces both body and mind. The attack deals an extra 4d6 psychic damage to the target. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks, and can't take reactions, until the end of its next turn.

level_4.name: Stone Shape
level_4.components: V, S, M (soft clay, which must be worked into roughly the desired shape of the stone object)
level_4.description: You touch a stone object of Medium size or smaller or a section of stone no more than 5 feet in any dimension and form it into any shape that suits your purpose. So, for example, you could shape a large rock into a weapon, idol, or coffer, or make a small passage through a wall, as long as the wall is less than 5 feet thick. You could also shape a stone door or its frame to seal the door shut. The object you create can have up to two hinges and a latch, but finer mechanical detail isn't possible.

level_4.name: Stoneskin
level_4.components: V, S, M (diamond dust worth 100 gp, which the spell consumes)
level_4.description: This spell turns the flesh of a willing creature you touch as hard as stone. Until the spell ends, the target has resistance to nonmagical bludgeoning, piercing, and slashing damage.

level_4.name: Wall of Fire
level_4.components: V, S, M (a small piece of phosphorus)
level_4.description: You create a wall of fire on a solid surface within range. You can make the wall up to 60 feet long, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick, or a ringed wall up to 20 feet in diameter, 20 feet high, and 1 foot thick. The wall is opaque and lasts for the duration. When the wall appears, each creature within its area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 5d8 fire damage on a failed save, or half on success. One side of the wall (your choice) deals 5d8 fire damage to each creature that ends its turn within 10 feet of that side or inside the wall. At higher levels: damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 4th.
