The wall sheds bright light out to 100 feet and dim light for an additional 100 feet. The wall consists of seven layers, each with a different color. A creature that attempts to reach into or pass through the wall is affected by each layer in turn. Each layer can be destroyed individually by specific means: Red (blocks nonmagical ranged attacks, 10d6 fire; destroyed by cold), Orange (blocks magical ranged attacks, 10d6 acid; destroyed by strong wind), Yellow (blocks all ranged attacks, 10d6 lightning; destroyed by force), Green (blocks everything, 10d6 poison; destroyed by daylight), Blue (blocks everything, 10d6 cold; destroyed by passwall), Indigo (blocks everything, restrained then petrified; destroyed by daylight), Violet (blocks everything, blinded then banished to another plane; destroyed by dispel magic). Antimagic field has no effect on the wall.

level_9.name: Shapechange
level_9.components: V, S, M (a jade circlet worth at least 1,500 gp, which you must place on your head before you cast the spell)
level_9.description: You assume the form of a different creature for the duration. The new form can be of any creature with a challenge rating equal to your level or lower. The creature can't be a construct or an undead. You assume the hit points and Hit Dice of the new form. When you revert, you return to the number of hit points you had before you transformed. You retain your alignment, personality, INT, WIS, and CHA scores, and your class features. You gain the new form's statistics and capabilities, except you don't gain any legendary actions or lair actions. You can transform into a different creature as an action.

level_9.name: Storm of Vengeance
level_9.description: A churning storm cloud forms, centered on a point you can see, and spreads to a radius of 360 feet. Lightning flashes, thunder booms, and strong winds roar. Each creature under the cloud when it appears must make a CON save or take 2d6 thunder damage and become deafened for 5 minutes. Each round, the storm produces different effects on your turn: Round 2 — acid rain, 1d6 acid damage per creature; Round 3 — lightning bolts (six bolts, DEX save, 10d6 lightning); Round 4 — hailstones, 2d6 bludgeoning damage per creature; Round 5–10 — gusting rain and wind, heavily obscured, ranged weapon attacks impossible, 1d6 cold damage per creature, visibility limited, and concentration checks required each turn.

level_9.name: Time Stop
level_9.description: You briefly stop the flow of time for everyone but yourself. No time passes for other creatures, while you take 1d4+1 turns in a row, during which you can use actions and move as normal. This spell ends if one of the actions you use during this period, or any effects that you create during this period, affects a creature other than you or an object being worn or carried by someone other than you. In addition, the spell ends if you move to a place more than 1,000 feet from the location where you cast it.

level_9.name: True Polymorph
level_9.components: V, S, M (a drop of mercury, a dollop of gum arabic, and a wisp of smoke)
level_9.description: Choose one creature or nonmagical object that you can see within range. You transform the creature into a different creature, the creature into an object, or the object into a creature. The transformation lasts for the duration, or until the target drops to 0 HP or dies. If you concentrate on this spell for the full duration, the transformation becomes permanent. Creature into Creature: the new form can be any CR equal to or less than the target's CR/level. The target's game statistics are replaced by the new form's stats. Creature into Object: the object can be no larger than the creature's size. Its game statistics become those of the object. Object into Creature: you can turn an object into any kind of creature whose CR is equal to or less than the object's size (Tiny = CR 0, Small = CR 1/4, Medium = CR 1/2, etc. up to Huge = CR maximum). An unwilling creature can make a WIS save to resist.

level_9.name: True Resurrection
level_9.components: V, S, M (a sprinkle of holy water and diamonds worth at least 25,000 gp, which the spell consumes)
level_9.description: You touch a creature that has been dead for no longer than 200 years and that died for any reason except old age. If the creature's soul is free and willing, the creature is restored to life with all its hit points. This spell closes all wounds, neutralizes any poison, cures all diseases, and lifts any curses affecting the creature when it died. The spell replaces damaged or missing organs and limbs. The spell can even provide a new body if the original no longer exists, in which case you must speak the creature's name. The creature then appears in an unoccupied space you choose within 10 feet of you.

level_9.name: Weird
level_9.description: Drawing on the deepest fears of a group of creatures, you create illusory creatures in their minds, visible only to them. Each creature in a 30-foot-radius sphere centered on a point of your choice within range must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, a creature becomes frightened for the duration. The illusion calls on the creature's deepest fears, manifesting its worst nightmares as an implacable threat. At the end of each of the frightened creature's turns, the creature must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or take 4d10 psychic damage. On a successful save, the spell ends for that creature.

level_9.name: Wish
level_9.description: Wish is the mightiest spell a mortal creature can cast. By simply speaking aloud, you can alter the very foundations of reality in accord with your desires. The basic use of this spell is to duplicate any other spell of 8th level or lower (no requirements needed, it simply takes effect). Alternatively, you can create effects beyond the scope of normal spells: create a nonmagical object of up to 25,000 gp in value, up to 300 feet in any dimension; up to 20 creatures regain all HP and end all effects on them as described in greater restoration; grant up to 10 creatures resistance to a chosen damage type; grant up to 10 creatures immunity to a single spell or effect for 8 hours; or undo a single recent event by forcing a reroll of any roll made within the last round. Using wish for anything other than duplicating a spell causes stress: 2d10 necrotic damage per spell level when casting (minimum STR of 3, or you can't cast spells for 2d4 days), and there is a 33% chance you are unable to cast wish ever again.
